result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ShiAnn Star Morris

records.addlTxt: Email sent to Oneida advising def has court on Dec 2;  ka
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:02 PM Defendant ShiAnn S. Morris appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for ShiAnn S. Morris.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF28, 21CF81, and 22CF116.  Atty, asking for plea and sentencing.  If def wants to be in person Atty to let jail know.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
1:24 PM Friend called for Defendant to get courts Zoom info b/c Def is in Oneida County Jail.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:08 AM Defendant ShiAnn S. Morris appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for ShiAnn S. Morris.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CF28, 21CF81 and 22CF116.  21CF28 is post arraignment, 21CF81 is post arraignment, 22CF116 is initial appearance.  Atty has not been able to discuss criminal compliant with def, asking for breakout room.  Back on the record 11:17.  22CF116 Atty, waive to prelim hearing, court accepts waiver.  Court reviewed compliant and finds probable cause def has committed a crime in ashland county, case bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now.  Atty, def waives reading, stands mute, NG noted.  Atty going to reach out to DA office to get global resolution.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to Oneida Co jail advising def has court on Aug 29;  ka
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:03 AM - 21 CF 28, 21 CF 81, 22 CF 116 - Prosecuting attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ShiAnn S. Morris appeared by video (fr Oneida Co).  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. appeared by video for ShiAnn S. Morris. SPD is attempting to find counsel for def..Mo to w/draw of Atty Rafferty, feels better to have one atty for ALL 3 cases.  Co Appt'd Atty Rafferty prev because SPD was unable to find.  Ct grants mo to w/draw by Rafferty & ct will appt atty on all 3 cases at Co expense.  Ct adj's cases today.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:49 AM Defendant ShiAnn S. Morris appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF28, 21CF81, and New Charges.  Special appearance Ralph Imholte.  STC on May 9 failed to appear on that date, warrant was issued in 21CF28 and 21CF81, cash bail forfeited at least the second time it has been forfeited.  Warrants quashed.  Regarding new charges probable cause is found that committed a crime in Ashland county.  Address 719 3rd Ave West mailing, 608 Willis is residential.  Not employed.  Has a pending case in Bayfield county.  State comments bail/bond.  Def comments on bail/bond.  Court sets cash bail at $2500 with all previous non-monetary conditions.  STC conference for cases 21CF28 and 21CF81 and initial appearance for new charges at next court date.   If def posts bail and is at liberty will need to appear in person.   Def advised to contact attorney.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
